Review: The only problem specially senior citizens has no lift going to 2nd floor
A good place to unwind when you have to bring along small children,
Old but still awesome and very nature!
Good location and food

The property grounds are very well maintained and nice. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The pool area is quite nice also. The rooms/bathrooms/Vinta bar are dated and could be udpated and should be upgraded for this price point. Basically everything on the outside of the property is excellent and everything on the inside is and has been in need of a facelift for sometime. I would reccommend the property for a stay in Davao city, however it lacks the newness, cleanliness, and convenience of the Radisson or Seda Abrezza that are similarly priced. If you want a real waterfront location with the ability to swim in the clean sea, then I would highly reccommend the Paradise Island Resort (there is no swimming pool) that is only a five minute boat ride away and a considerably better value.
Just need a gym or workout room, otherwise, I would've given it a 5 star.
the room was hot and even requested for a fan! (which was a first time even for a frequent traveller like me) they should uprgade the rooms and ac
nice place to chill with family
Place price staff and food

Hotel is old with bad air conditioning, real bad internet signal and even worse tv. Probably one of the very few to still use unhygienic shower curtains. Bathroom is really outdated and all amenitie boxes were empty, yes empty. No toothbrushes, no soap, no qtips, no shaving kit etc. Also, no conditioner and only one pair of slippers for the two of us. Location is ok with nice gardens and dirty beach
Value for money! Good location

We found a bug in my husband's seafood java rice! We immediately told the waitress... no apologies from the waitress, nor the manager. Worse part was that i had to remind the waitress to take out the rice from the buffet table, she said they were busy.

Most friendly and helpful receptionist ever, so lovely and great first impression of hotel. Couldn't have been more sweet, giving me directions to a function I was attending along with a helpful map, ensuring parking in car park and facilitating an early check in. If nothing else had gone right with hotel this lady ensured I would have left with a good impression. Fortunately everything about the hotel was exceptional, and I don't give praise lightly. It was clean, stylish, roomy with excellent service in both bar where we had lunch and restaurant where we had dinner. Food was beyond good and great value for money and service in both places attentive and efficient. Room itself was well equipped and comfortable. I could go on but suffice it to say I was very pleased with my stay, and although short and sweet this time, I hope to be back for a longer visit in the future.
Its a landmark in davao but needs renovation rooms are like 70 year olds,water from faucet smells like coming from rusted pipes.
Perfect location. Great homemade pastries.
great place to relax and enjoy with your family
Rolex watch got lost in this hotel and they would not even make me view CCTV. Why? Crooks!
Centrally located, beach front, good breakfast buffet.

We booked for a deluxe room but we’re so lucky upgraded to executive suite for free. The room is so spacious and the best view in front of the sea. Breakfast foods is healthy and had choices. But the restaurant Don’t have order good for two. We need to go out for dinner. Best place we will be back soon. Thanks for our free upgraded room.

It was a very disappointing experience for me as I was given with a room which had a faulty AC, poor wifi connection, and room itself looked dirty. For a 3k++ per night without breakfast, it was such a very poorly maintained room. The staffs were also very slow to respond to an extent that I have been ringing the front desk for more than 15times! I am definitely not going back sad to say.

Hotel was ok,little dated pool wasn’t as big as it looked in photos,wasn’t cleaned as much as u would wanted ..to many floating stuff and it green algae on the sides and floor of the deep parts..BRING YOUR OWN WATER..so expensive here
In a very short stay , i feel comfortable and happy, rest assure that i can recommend to my friend.
The room is huge and clean. nice place to stay
Just ok - no elevator though
Filipino with western breakfast is good.
Location is very nice if you like the beach. Food is great but expensive.
It is a beautiful resort and relaxing environment

We enjoyed our brief stay and were happy with our room and the courtesy shown by the staff. A bit disappointed when walking around the gardens to see pieces of litter on the grass and in the flower beds. For a hotel of this standard, more care needs to be given to the general look of the surrounding area as it disappoints the eyes. Otherwise happy with our time together at the Insular.

The Hotel it self just needs major upgrades or rebuild. The two major concerns are both Health Issues(Room #254) The water out of faucets during first use produce a rusty or dirty water. I had to ask for additional water bottles to brush my teeth and rinse with. Very Unhealthy! This should not be an issue for the cost and ratings attached with this hotel. When asked I was told the hotel is just old. ???? The other is the beautiful pool they have as a center of the resort. The pool had green algae in it but when I asked how they cleaned it the staff very surprisingly informed me that they do not have a water filter ration system and they do not change the water out. I watched them just scoop lots of chemicals into the pool after close. So please be careful if you decide to swim in the pool. When the staff advices you to be cautious then this is not good. The rest of the resort is great. The staff is outstanding. I hope they sent a little profit to fix it back up soon.
Hotel is simply amazing! I tried spa massage 1 hour and I received a very good massage for a small price. Excellent if you’re looking for a relaxing place
nice view
Pool is very deep even for adult. I think 10ft is too much.

Hotel has a very large compound and has its own pier and beach area. Hotel from the outside and all the common areas looks immaculate. Rooms are big but dated and is carpeted and will need replacing soon. The size of the room is quite BIG and provides a lot of room to move around. Bed was big and very soft and provided a good nights sleep. Because the hotel is in their own compound you do not hear any of the street noise. The gym is situated in their own building and looks to be equipped with modern exercise equipment and well maintained. The only disappointing feature of the hotel is the size of the swimming pool, it is relatively small for the size and potential number of guests it can host. Definitely worth staying if you have the opportunity.
room, service ,food enviroment good.
Great breakfast- and lunch buffé. Thanks for the great service when our daughter got sick. Free medical sevice (doctor and nurse).

We had stayed here twice in the past year and we wished the room air-conditioning was better. It was not comfortable staying in the room just to relax. It seems like the cooling is not refrigerated and it was not cool 85% of the time. For a very humid place like Davao City it should be refrigerated air. It is located away from the main highway but not too far. It is quiet and the landscape is beautiful. It is nice to walk in the morning around the property grounds not only because it is conducive but it is also safe. It is only a 15 minute boat ride to one of the best beaches in Davao City - Paradise Island Resort. It's also about 25 minutes (if no traffic) from downtown and 20 minutes to the airport. The staff generally were very friendly and they generally greeted you at every opportunity. The rooms were clean but the cleaners kept forgetting certain items each day - a little annoyance. They're still a long ways from communication technology - hard to connect from overseas.

The name speaks for itself. It is fronting the beach and my family had fun wading the water during low tide. They still have starfishes, hermit crabs and sea urchins at the beach which is rare for a well developed beach, the kids loved it! Will come back for 2018 NYE since the location gives a good view of the fireworks in Samal Island.

The room was spacious. Beds are comfortable. Bathroom old and need renovation. Waterleaking from shower. Hard to get towels. Seems like they do not have enough. Nice staff everywhere. The pizza and pasta restaurant not so high quality food. Same for breakfast. Waited for room-service finner for 1,5 hours. Wi-fi is very slow. Will come back though.
Fruit salad tiramiso had molds. room had mouse

We usually go to waterfront for stay-cations because we want to relax but the recent stay that we had was not comforting at all. Pool use was limited to 2 persons only per room (staff said it was their guidelines) but we never got informed ahead of time/or knew this rule existed (we tried to swim the next day with kids and we were not got apprehended, we even saw other guest swim with party of 5 or more people). Another concern, we understood that it was the busiest part of the season but having checked us past 2pm (2:30pm exactly) was not acceptable. We even called ahead of time the prior day to confirm our booking and the room we want to stay (front desk- agreed and confirmed to me my request). Considering that guest are allowed only late check-out until 1pm only, checking us 2:30pm is very upsetting. On room emeneties, we were only given 1 pair of slippers, the attendant told us that they only provide 1 pair of slippers per room, are you guys cross-cutting??? On our next plan, we mi
Slow internet connection. Over-rated.
We will come back,,,
Environment is nice, garden & sea view. Cons: building is old, room flooring, toilet, & aisle carpet needs to be replaced.
i love the gardens and wide rooms..will be back soon...
Nice hotel ideal for family vacation

I was having fun watching my 4 kids swimming in the pool when one of the pool staff came to inform me that there’s additional fee if there are more than 2 persons in the room... I booked the room for 2 adults and 3 kids (teens) and it didn’t say anything about the allowed number of guests per room... We arrived late and there was a wedding event until 11pm... I couldn’t sleep right away.... No eye contact from the front desk staff at check in... they probably thought we were local but that’s not an excuse... I used to work in the Hospitality industry too and first thing you do at check in is make sure the guests feel welcomed. Overall, it was an okay hotel for the money.

We booked our dinner for Christmas Eve through the front desk and they confirmed it. When we went to the restaurant at 6 pm, they said it is by reservation only and they would not seat us inside because it is buffet but said we always can dine outside. My ever pleasant husband just agreed. One family was furious about this set up and was complaining to their staff. I went over to them and also explained that since we were guests of the hotel, it should not be a problem seating us for the dinner even if it is buffet by reservation. Apparently, they do not communicate with the front desk. Anywho, management showed up and fixed us a table inside. I was very grateful because there were too many mosquitoes biting outside and was developing so many hives in my skin. Other than this misadventure, our stay was pleasant. They could update the rooms, the one we stayed at was facing a boiler. It was large but dated. But for a temporary stay, it was adequate. Their meals at the restaurant were definitely world class and the service desk were also good. They have great architecture too, and impressive grounds, with adequate parking for a Davao City hotel (it can be problematic). Altogether it is great value for the money.
Bathroom should have bidette

We have always loves the hospitality and rooms at the waterfront but i wish they had the bidet in the washroom and that the kids pool was kept in better condition. Staff are always helpful and food is great. No bacon during breakfast but the rest was great

If you want a quite environment and near the beach, then this hotel is for you especially if you want to take a side tour in Samal Island. Breakfast was good but I hope they change a lot of menus everyday. If you want to explore the city proper of Davao or go to further north, then prepare some extra money for your transportation because their location is quite far. However, they are near to SM City Lanang and Abreeza Mall.
The room smell of mold throughout the night was very persistent. Good thing we reserved for only one night., because we hardly slept because of the odor.

Frontdesk must be more attentive tonthe booking, i called to inform that we will be arriving late and ask for king bed as i am travelling with my daughters,staff told me that they only have twin bed, but they can move it together, i arrived and nearly 2300 inquired again if there is king bed w/c was told no and acknowledge my call earlier informing that the room is ready and bed as required has been set up. Arrived in the room nothing has done, has to call housekeeping w/c according to them they were not aware as no request from FO made. Had to asked to bathmath Check out was asked if there is anything in minibar, but minibar was locked how can we use? Isnt it supposed to be open prior if you are assigning the room to the guest? Or subject to request? Staff/hostess at Breakfast area has no warmth at all, you only have few guest ang yet you cant even recognize. No children room amenities Knowing that i am travelling with kids i was assigned on a connecting room?

I have high expectations with Waterfront Insular Hotel in Davao. Though it is one of the oldest hotels in the city, i have considered it as the "grand dame of hotels" - the spaciousness, the "exclusivity" feel upon entering it's premises, the classic Maranaw architecture that exudes the culture of the place. The "oldness" is forgivable, but how can Waterfront give its name to it when the service sucks? The bellboys/attendants do not listen when you give them specific instructions. The room i have reserved should be good for 3 people, but when i came to check, it still has 2 single beds. Wanted to use the gym in the morning, and have repeatedly asked that equipment be turned on. But requests landed on deaf ears. I hope the management would invest in good people who are passionate about their jobs and be willing to seriously take their training, if they have ever undergone such activity. Still commendable is the immaculate garden and good breakfast buffet.

The hotel held a party and didn't ask the guest prior to check in if they would be ok with loud music. At 9pm I asked for the volume to be lowered, instead they turned up the bass, and played rock around the clock and wake up little Sussie, with intermittent blasts of rap music with an extremely high bass. I thought this was a slap in the face, since I just asked if they could turn it down. Will never stay here again or recommend to anyone I like.
Outdated.
our stay had been good until it's paying time, the breakfast staff charge additional for our child(full charge) for our 7y/o kiddo who hardly eat any.
It's a beautiful place and excellent.
Very friendly staff & spacious room
if you a place away from the busy streets, then choose waterfront insular
We were able to checked in almost 6 in the evening.

I have to pay $120 deposit. I stayed to 5 different hotels in Davao none of them asked for a deposit but only Insular hotel. I extended my stay for $99. The rest of my stay cost $54 a night. Why pay $99 for an extended night. Their food service is bad- the room service. They brought us cold eggs. The toasted bread we ordered was not toasted. They put us in room with an ugly view, where you can see ugly trees and dirty roof, dirty yard. I asked to transfer but it will cost me more. But we have to move anyway because the air-condition was not working. When you get there, everything is expensive. They will try to rip you off when they can. I am not going back to Insular...

Wonderful spacious grounds, next to the sea and with a great swimming pool. Good restaurants/bars and good location, quite central in Davao. The airport is only about 20 minutes away. Clean spacious rooms. Very comfortable. Helpful staff. Overall. Highly recommended.
Nice place but it took us an hour to check in and also checking out takes an hour. Nice place though.
over priced for a rundown property
The ambience

At first i was so so furious at 2 bellboys trying to flirt with my fiance I gave a 1 star rating for "staff". Now i'm changing that rating to 3 stars based on the strength of a front desk clerk who tracked down my lost luggage. It took 6 days but she found the responder and stayed on top of him. I hope they read this and adopt a NO FLIRTING WITH GUESTS POLICY. IF so I will be back.
we enjoy our stay. breakfast buffet is so delicious.

I was there with my fiance. We brought her parents and sister and everyone was having a great time. Then as all of us were walking to the lobby my fiance was trailing behind us slightly and 2 bellboys started flirting with her. I don't just mean the polite smile. These guys were intend on getting with her. I turned around and saw her blushing and I went back and grabbed her hand and gave those 2 pricks the dirtiest look i could. This was NO COMPLIMENT! This was an attempt to SLEEP with the girl I love. I KNOW THE DIFFERENCE! The rest of the staff was great, ESPECIALLY one front desk clerk that took it upon herself, using her own phone (!! :) ) to track down a bag the airline lost. I know a couple of creeps should not prevent me from recommending this hotel but the anger and violence I felt towards these 2 was off the charts. The Management needs to set a new strict policy NO FLIRTING WITH GUESTS! UNTIL then i cannot recommend this hotel yet. However I intend to return as I am assuming they will read this and implement that new policy. If that is the case I thought it was the best location on the island.

The hotel is well maintained and clean. Airconditioning of rooms are very good. Shuttle service can be arranged for a fee. We just used grab application on our entire stay. There are little annoyances when ordering food and drinks. We ordered frapuccinos from the pool snack/bar area. We got hot cappucinos instead. We ordered a bucket of beer with included snacks from the bar but got only beers. Maybe because it is near 1:00 am and they run out of the food or could not be bothered. These annoyances does not ruin the experience Rooms are good clean and comfortable I rate Waterfront Davao 4 out of 5 score

1. provision of ramps for PWD (person with disability) especially going up and down the room. 2. the stairs to the room that I have booked last November 1 at Deluxe Room is quite big, I think half of the space can be ramp for PWD. My father love the size of our room but only he is not comfortable of going up the stairs because he is amputated already. We later on found out that the hotel has a provision of rooms for PWD but the room is standard. My father preferred the Deluxe type of room than the standard room.
Wish all restrooms and bathrooms had bidet.

The beautiful rooms were complemented by the amazing sea, pool, and garden view. Food was great and the staff were very accommodating. My family and I enjoyed the 10ft pool and the poolside area was very relaxing. The overall mood was serene and stress relieving. I highly recommend this place to people who want to experience the convenience of a modern and classy hotel with a luxury resort feel.
It's always a good time in at Insular. Although the facilities are a bit dated and can use a bit of sprucing up, it still does its job. Will definitely stay here again.
Wonderful place. I'll remember it.

Hotel amenities was excellent.Rooms are good size ,clean.Staff was impressivefrom reception to room attendants to to grounds people.Food was very good.Swimming pool and hotel grounds very well maintained.Definitely staying again .
The hotel needs some renovation especially the Comfort room...at this time they dont have bidet's.
Was worried because of martial law. But was comforted by multiple gates and security with rifles. You can be very safe here.

The only negative ican find in hotel is the smell of old carpet (damp smell) at the corridor,and the need for a proper bread toaster at the breakfast restaurant .Icannot find fault in their staff (very gracious),food in the restaurant was delicious,well maintained gardens ,lovely swimming pool.We’re definitely recommending and staying in this hotel again.
Had bad experience, water ran out in the middle of my shower

We arrived at the airport by 6:15am 25min ahead schedule but we stay at the airport until 8 then we decide to go to hotel just to drop our luggages but they allowed as to check in by 9 w/o extra charge thats a big plus the facilities are good but sa beach front is not good hope to clean it coz in the night theres a lot of small fish in the shore
The most family fruendly hotel in davao because of its gardens
Conveniently located. Even if I arrived late in the evening around 11:30pm, check-in was still a breeze.

The ONLY hotel to stay at in Davao. Traditional but well kept rooms; beautifully manicured grounds, pool and private beach; great food and beverage operation; and the most perfectly mannered, helpful staff. The fiance and I always stay here on my visits to DVO.

Getting aged in the rooms but they are clean and they have good amenities. The location and grounds are the best, it's very quiet here unless there's a wedding. Food at the cafes is great and all the staff are friendly and helpful.
It's an old hotel - room smells old and looks not well polished. However, the view and the surroundings is very beautiful. It is very relaxing to stay outside and see around.

I had my wedding recep there. Ballroom was fully booked so got the function room instead. Ample space however slightly run down. Other than this the rest of the amenities were good like the pool and the sea view areas. A little pricey to stay there.
The hotel garden atmosphere and proximity to the sea give relaxing mood all throughout the day. The wide ground is secure and ideal for children and walking.
Badly needs maintenance and modernisation
We appreciate Ace, the one who helped us in our room . And also buffet breakfast is great!!
Everything is great here from the staff to facilities to food and location. Only some improvement in the gym facilities especially if you are a gym goer.
Very very friendly staff .quiet.great grounds. Pool bar to expensive they need to lower that so we can enjoy more

I love this place. My wife is not a big fan, mostly because of the age of the facility. It does need a bit of an overhaul. But I like the age, it has character, and the location is awesome. Very relaxing to stay here when they are not having a wedding event or party in the poolside outdoor buildings. We stay garden side to avoid the noise. I think you would enjoy a stay here if you take my advice. :) Breakfast buffet is great.

Reception was not welcoming. Advised via agoda early arrival at 10-11 am but did not allow us to check in early . After speaking to their office manager that said room was ready 2 hours ago and then released key to us. All furniture are old , poor Aircon ,requested garden view but ended up river and jungle view, house keeping was very rude, pool bar services was horrible . We had guess for dinner just walked in at 8.00 pm and they told us pool bar will be closed at 8.45 pm . Order food and drinks was serve red late and at 8.50 pm they told us they are closing and switch off light while we still having our drinks. I have to extend my from 15/9 till 17/9 but they say full occupancy. I fell very embarrassing and have to look for other hotel in town . For 5 days stay they can't even accommodate us for 2 nights more . Suggest agoda should look into type of hotels like this which is not worth the money we spend for. Totally and great regret and will never ever think of this hotel !
the place is a little old, the room has defective aircon, it took hours before the staff arrived to fix it... we ended using an electric fan for the whole stay... rooms are dark.

This is the only hotel that has a big and wide are for strolling. Someone who love natures and quite environment this will be the hotel for you. The hotel rooms are in ancient time you will appreciate more the history and why they are huge in teems of land area. This hotel is overlooking samal Island. If you love modern style, this is not the perfect hotel for you.
This hotel needs major improvements including the beach and front desk staff. Asked for Iron and for over filled sink to be fixed and no response. Beach had plastic and garbage washing up on it.
Old facility but well kept.

First off: I was staying in the hotel for three nights hence I had breakfast for three days. On each of those 3 days, I had the (dis)pleasure of getting angry glances and rude comments whenever I stuffed my croissant on the communal toaster. There were two toasters - one black and one white. The white one showed maybe a year's worth of blackened, roasted crumbs. The black one, although bearing the same amount of crumbs was less noticeable. Therefore, everyone put their bread on the white one. There was a line for said toaster. Whenever I put a piece of my croissant in the toaster along with other people's bread there, I get weird stares. Please get a rolling-type industrial toaster. Please. On the subject of the room: The room was pretty clean and decent. It is what one will expect in a "heritage hotel". There is a flair of old-world grandeur in there. There was, however, a lack of outlets for charging stuff. The AC is also a bit lacking in power. The TOILET NEEDS A FULL RENOVATION. It is like stepping in a shower from the 70s. There was a night where there were a couple of mosquitoes in the room. I got bitten. I called the front desk and they sent staff to spray the room promptly. The hotel facilities are great - especially the pool area. I spent hours and hours there everyday. The pool facilities are resort-like. I would snack there and just lounge! Will I recommend Water Front Insular to friends? Well, yes. But please: 1.) Update the in-room TOILETS 2.) Put more plugs by the bedside 3.) Please liven up the dark hallway leading to the rooms 4.) Please change the toasters in the breakfast outlet Other than that, we're good!
good stay and good customer service...breakfast is really good...nice hotel and very much well maintained...
free use of pool . buffet breakfast is really good. for this you get value of the money you paid.
Nice place to unwind!
Overall the stay was good but hopefully they can do somehting about the beach. The Waterfront (beach) isnt that good at all.
I love their super soft bed & pillows.
Best in Davao City

Have submitted a detailed review directly to the Waterfront via their site and Facebook site regarding some very serious concerns. The reply was a very basic automated one, non specific. I will not return to this hotel, as there is an upper management 'Lack of Customer Care' factor going on. And no real apology.
some of the facility is in need of improvement or upgrade. the rest is ok especially the ambiance this place is for relaxing.
The room is spacious and well furnished, the facilities are enjoyable, the surrounding is beautiful
Staff
Nice resort.... Nice and big garden .... I enjoy my stay there ....
Very nice resort with big garden ... close to the beach ....I enjoy stay there ..I like everything in that hotel

Was thrilled when our room was upgrade when they knew we were on our honeymoon. Breakfast was great and sumptuous. Bedroom was spacious with fresh crisp linen sheet and fluffy pillow which makes you feel at home. Customer service good. Special mention to Ms. Rocelle Gecale, the customer coordinator who enthusiastically gave us the tour of the property. Swimming pool was superb with heated waters on a cool night.
Best hotel for tourists!!!

The hotel is a great place fro a relaxing stay. The environment is beautiful and the gardens and beach are so relaxing. The food is good and well prepared with very good service. I have only one complaint that being that the adjoining doors of the rooms, offer little defence to the conversation of the people in the next room and if they are having a family conversation at 1.00am or 5 am you are a party to it whether you wish or not ?. Please listen to this request and fit double insulated doors so that guests can have the privacy of their own room.
As always, it was a nice stay in this hotel. The whole ambiance is relaxing and calm. The staff are always nice and accommodating. The rooms are decent and clean. Will be back for sure.
i enjoyed my stay..

Stayed here as couple for two (2) nights. We attended a wedding here so we decided to book here and we were not mistaken. The view, the room and facilities were great. Though at that time, it seems that they lack staff especially since there were big events on that weekend. Still, the staff were responsive to our needs. The deluxe room is great, is spacious and has our needs. The bed is comfortable and the TV has channels for your entertainment. Points for improvement: Faster refilling of food during buffet breakfast :) Overall, our experience as a couple in Waterfront is great, the staff are commendable and we may consider staying here again if we go back to Davao.

Good location, HK staff are the stars, Reservation Staff? They need to up their service as they will let you wait for long, Restaurant Staff? They need to be proactive and keep an eye on the guest rather than being busy talking with each other. Centralised aircon need some upgrading as it's not working properly, bathroom needs proper redecorating seen its days for a 4 star hotel,

No preparation for guests to sit near the beach; there is a lack of chairs everywhere except in the restaurants. Beach is dirty. Water in the pool is dirty not suitable for swimming. Bathroom water is stinky and has metallic taste. Smokers designated area showing disrespect to smokers!!! Seems like smokers are monkies in a circus!
There is nowhere better in Davao.
We always stay here, there is nowhere better in Davao.

The hotel was old, but very nice. The staff was friendly and quickly and efficiently accommodated all of our requests. My son enjoyed the pool. The food at the breakfast buffet and restaurants, and from room service was excellent! I will stay here again when traveling to Davao.

Pros: Child/damily friendly environment Value for money Breaksfast buffet has alot of options Friendly and helpful staff Cons: Old smelling building No bidet Stated in agoda that the room has tub but upon reaching the room - no tub
but classy. kind staff. worthy breakfast. connected samal island. definitely will visit again.
spent 4 days here! it was great, the staff were amazing. had a good swim in the pool..
Waterfront never fails toamaza us. We (couple) and specially our kids kids love staying herr. There are lot of space/area to roam around and staffs are very friendly.

We ordered Cake for the month Teramisu crepe and from the taste of it, its already spoiled, the fact that its expensive they need to check what is being serve and make sure its freshly bake all the time or to take note expiration. Though its far from the city, but the beach, the fresh air and the view is worth it.

Still a fairly well maintained hotel that stands out among the newer, more modern, but less pleasant places to stay in the city. Wonderful king-sized bed, reliable hot water, warm staff, peaceful tropical ambience, nice little terrace/balcony with small table and chairs. I didn't mind the extra 15- or 20-minute taxi ride downtown (less than US$3) as more centrally located accommodations seem way overpriced. Cheap room was cheap though: scratched-up floor, no bidet, no bathtub, ancient shower, barebones amenities, unattractive view from the window. Strengths: Spacious grounds with soothing water features and lots of greenery; relaxing resort feel; seashore view; impressively renovated facilities. Weaknesses: Those parts not recently renovated definitely showing age; unexciting basic menu; underdeveloped grounds. Particular suggestions: Improve on the tacky concrete items on the grounds (e.g. fugly benches and "gazebos" at the beach) and make the swimming facilities bigger and more interesting.
All staffs were kind Very quiet & lovely place to stay. However, There was no shower gown bc they ran out.. so they gave me more towels. The air conditione was too loud and not cool enough.

The hotel is quite far from malls and other stuffs but in the hotel itself, you can have great fun by renting their jet ski and other water sports. If you're on the thrift side, you can just simply enjoy the beach and the pool.
Waterfront Insular is within Davao City and thr gateway to Samal Island renowned beach and resort destination of Davao. So its a package deal a comfortable and relaxing place to stay! Keep it !

The location is wonderful and the staff all friendly, helpful and smiling. There is a big green area and you have the ocean in front of you. Some rooms have views to the pool and the sea. Only negative is that rooms and bathrooms are a bit outdated but the beautiful environment around the hotel fully compensates for this. The water in the swimming pool and the children's pool is not up to the standard of a beautiful hotel but the very friendly and understanding management is about to update the filtration system to make this place the place of choice in Davao.
Nice but the place needa maintenance
Nice Buffet choices, i just didnt like the fact that they didnt have any smoking area. I cant even use my room's own balcony for that.
We came to attend a wedding there and its the perfect location where everything was accessible to gather and go about.

The Staff was very friendly and helpful. Everything about this place was great. Quiet with great security. Would have earned 5 out of 5 for me except during the day, the next room to us was being renovated and we could smell the painting going on which can be quite distracting. Other than this its the perfect getaway. Bonus part is they can arrange for passage to Samal Island and they also have free shuttles to the mall.
Many guests check in, some delay due to room cleaning. Front desk & cleaning staff were putting their best efforts to accommodate & speed up processing.

Rooms are large, good size pool and location is close to the airport. Had 3 rooms for various family members and air conditioning didn't work properly in any of them. Small ants in the rooms are another issue. The beach attached to the hotel suffers from pollution, so you cant really swim there. Is it worth p4000 per night? Maybe for a short stay

Everything is old, personnel is trying to his best but not capable to do better , a good hotel for all the people from all the old (and old money ) villages around it, maybe it is better to call it a resort than a hotel, never go to the barbecue buffet, you only get sick of it, and room cleaning can be still at 17.30?

The hotel is really classy and had the feeling of grandiose. We really like the comfort, the FOOD, etc. The problem is the AC is not that cold, it's only mild cold. We were also not given a room with a bathtub because it's only available on the 2nd floor rooms and apparently it's all full. The TV didn't work properly at first and the service had to be in our room for more than 30mins. The hotel looks nice and classy but it's really old. It's really a 4-star hotel on its class but we didn't feel special as guests so we're really disappointed on their service. Everything else, it's good. We usually remember our entire stay, but in this time, we're disappointed by many things. The only thing that we can really appreciate is the Breakfast Buffet.
For a nature lover like me, the hotel is the best among those I've been... Would definitely recommend it to my relatives and friends.. thanks waterfront insular hotel, we had a wonderful stay..

the water in the shower turned cold so suddenly when the toilet was flushed! I was bathing my 2 year old son then!!!!

Pros: location, fresh air, sea breeze, pool, big rooms, good food Exceptional: well-mannered and courteous staff Cons: it took AGES (2+ hours) to get our room ready, even if it was past the check-in time. We were also told that the rooms (one bed instead of two) we asked for (a couple of wks prior to check in) were not available. The hotel was v busy over the weekend but the manager (who we were told was not available!) should have seen this coming and would have prepared for contingencies. I dont know if the hotel overbooked or if other guests were prioritised but this check-in was particularly strenous and disorganised.

We stayed at Waterfront Insular Davao last December 9-10, 2016 (Overnight) to relax and celebrate my Birthday. I was really disappointed with the hotel receptionist. The supposed check in time was 2:00pm. We arrived at around 12:30pm. I was asked to wait while they were preparing the room (Deluxe Premium-Pool View). I waited for 30 minutes, the room was still not prepared. I asked the receptionist if we can take our lunch first while they were preparing the room. The girl receptionist commited that when we return from lunch, the room will be ready for us. When we returned, the room is still not available. We waited for 1 hour. I saw all receptionists cramming because more guests were on queue waiting for the room to be available, not only us. When I raised my voice and complained about the poor service, I just don't know what happened, the room key was provided. On the amenities, Beach fronting the Samal Island is a good way to relax but you cannot swim. The shoreline is very dirty, not maintained. You can see garbages around. The swiiming pool is 10 feet deep. If you are not a good swimmer, never mind on this amenity. The pool water is itchy to the Skin. The buffet breakfast was perfect. The room is quite old but still good. Water flow in the bathroom was miserable. When I was in the bathtub, the water on the faucet stopped flowing. Good thing when we called the frontdesk, temporary solution was made. I was advised by the technician that there was leak and needs to be fixed permanently. Overall, this Hotel is only suitable for Big Company Conventions or Seminars. If you wish to find a Hotel to Relax and enjoy the Amenities as couple or family, nevermind. There are still other options out there.

1.We had to request for a room transfer as the room (supposedly one of the newer rooms) was very musty. We could hardly breathe. Our allergies started acting up as the air was heavy, moldy, musty. It was oppressive. 2. The beds were lumpy and every time we moved it would creak and bump into the headboard. 3. The screen door to the balcony fell on us, light bulbs were missing, and amenities were incomplete (i.e. there was shampoo but no soap; they lacked one pair of slippers). 4. The electrical wiring of the lights were odd, such that you had to turn on the hallway lights for the bathroom lights to turn on which made it inconvenient for those sleeping as the hallway light was quite bright. 5. For breakfast, our family (of 3) ordered eggs, bacon/ham, toast, rice. Our order came 50 min after and it was served cold!!! This was when there were only a handful of guests in the dining area. 6.It took us almost an hour just to check in. They need to review their system as it was very inefficient. Imagine, a front desk officer cutting coupons laboriously, while a long line of guests were waiting to be checked in under the heat of an non-ariconditioned lobby. The process took too long. They were apologetic after but we've already suffered the inconvenience. 7. The staff was very accommodating and helpful but I think they could only do so much when the rooms need to be badly re-furbished. 8. They do not deserve the 4 to 4.5 star rating given the overall condition of the rooms and F&B quality and service. I will not recommend staying in this hotel.

It is a good place for a walk and enjoy the nature if you love walking. I consider this place as one of the relaxing hotel in Davao. Fresher air compare to downtown hotels. Scheduled shuttle bus is available if you need to go to the shopping malls. Foods are quite good! One thing negative is far from grocery/convenient store for emergency or necessary stuff et al. ran out nappies or medicines for my little girl. Over all, the hotel is really good that is why we are back here for our last week before heading back home. I will recommend it to my other friends who wants to visit Davao.

I have stayed at the Waterfront Insular a number of times since 2009 so I obviously like it. The restaurants are good, staff delightful, big rooms with nice balconies, and the grounds and swimming pool very good with a delightful ambience. A great retreat from the city and I expect to go back. That said, I'll list the few things I'd like to see fixed. The bathrooms have tubs with the shower within, I estimate the shower head to be about 5ft 8 in above the bottom of the tub. This is a problem for someone taller than that and for me, at 6 ft 4 in, its a real pain. Add to that that the water pressure is not great and even worse when generators are in use and I have to do contortions with my arm up the side of the wall to rinse my body and bend way down to get my head wet. The water pressure problem also effects the sink where you'll often get an explosion of water due to an air bubble when you turn on the sink getting your clothes all wet. One other thing that has always been a problem, the shower curtain does not stop the water from running down outside the tub to the floor and the floor drain is not the lowest spot on the floor so you get quite a substantial puddle that doesn't go away over night - ridiculous. Normally I wouldn't care about this in inexpensive stay overnight hotels but its supposed to be a 4 star hotel. Be careful in the bar, San Miguel beers average about P120 per bottle. When you consider that you can buy the same beer by the case of 24 for about P20 per bottle, the price is steep. Western guests used to much higher prices may not mind but I've lived here a while. Add to that the fact that the bulk of the bar staff were college students on OJT and not being paid and the price is high. We discovered the price when my wife and I noticed there were no patrons and wondered why. Hmmmm. All things considered, I expect to go back, the good far outweighs the bad.
